channel.title: Turtleman
channel.description:
I'm not sure if you have seen the episode on discovery channel (I think that's the channel?), but this guy is simple insane. The show is called Call of the Wildman. He catches all of his nuisance calls bare hand, and is actually very intelligent despite his looks. He is 100% genuine and if you watch some of the earlier shows it is funny how awkward he is on television. He's quite possibly one of the nicest people that are on this planet. I've seen some episodes where he will clean out an entire house just for 3 jars of canned green beans or a homemade sign the family made for him. He said it is those things that touch him the most. One time they rescued a copperhead from a banjo shop, and his friend (who plays the banjo) was given a homemade banjo from the shop that had all of these symbols that everyone knows Turtleman by down in Kentucky. On the show, when he was talking about it he started choking up he was so touched they would do that for his friend. If you haven't seen it, I highly suggest you watch it, as not only is it quite entertaining, but Turtleman seems to be a great man. There isn't a fake bone in his single body.
[img]http://www.venaticfanatics.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/12/turtleman1.jpg[/img]

item.title: Turtleman
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:12, topic:457218”]He seems too genuine in his actions and too awkward on the television to be “acting”. Although you are right, it could just be a feign, although I just highly doubt it. I hope that you aren’t right, as we really need more people on this world that are like him. He may not look the nicest, but I’d rather have 10 hillbillies who look like they haven’t seen a toothbrush, who are the nicest, most genuine people you have ever seen, rather than 10 stuck up pricks who think they are better than everyone else because they are wealthy or whatnot.

I had a hard time reading this topic clearly, but I’ve watched the show before and I thought it was pretty stupid. Can you base one’s entire intellect off of wildlife skills?

He knows a lot about animals rather than just knowing how to track them, and he obviously loves what he does which explains why he knows so much.[/quote]

I will agree completely that his actions seem to be genuine. This could also be the mark of a fantastic actor though. I’m actually going to see what I can dig up in regards as to his acting career.

Read full topic

He seems too genuine in his actions and too awkward on the television to be “acting”. Although you are right, it could just be a feign, although I just highly doubt it. I hope that you aren’t right, as we really need more people on this world that are like him. He may not look the nicest, but I’d rather have 10 hillbillies who look like they haven’t seen a toothbrush, who are the nicest, most genuine people you have ever seen, rather than 10 stuck up pricks who think they are better than everyone else because they are wealthy or whatnot.

the elve age:

I had a hard time reading this topic clearly, but I’ve watched the show before and I thought it was pretty stupid. Can you base one’s entire intellect off of wildlife skills?

He knows a lot about animals rather than just knowing how to track them, and he obviously loves what he does which explains why he knows so much.

Read full topic

item.title: Turtleman
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:2, topic:457247”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=560151.msg4090955#msg4090955 date=1346353519]
I hate this show with a fiery burning passion. Every time I hear this idiot yell “YEYEYEYEYEYEYE”, I put a newborn kitten into a sack and throw it into a river.

You can’t possibly judge someone’s character based on watching them on T.V. Sure he seems nice and genuine, but Jeffery Dahmer didn’t look like he killed people, had sex with their dead bodies, and then ate them.
[/quote]Yet your judging him now on his looks?[/quote]

I’m just making the point that you can’t judge a book by It’s cover. Saying It’s a decent show is one thing, but sucking off his character is another. The person everyone sees on the T.V. is The Turtleman. The person nobody sees on T.V. is the man who plays The Turtleman.

Read full topic

item.title: Turtleman
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I love this show.

The payments seem fake, but I also feel that they aren’t. He cleared a lake of snapping turtles that were targeting a girl’s pigs (that girl was hot), and he took like 2 cans of peaches and $50.

Pretty entertaining show to watch. It’s amazing how he can avoid getting hurt often.

Read full topic
